items.question: Which is a characteristic of a child with ADHD?

Three subtypes of ADHD are inattentive type, predominantly hyperactive-impulsive type and

Fidgeting with hands or feet, leaving the seat running or climbing excessively, and talking excessively are characteristics of

For students who have inattentive type of ADHD, teachers should make sure students have enough time to shift from one activity to another, allow flexible limits for finishing works, simply task that have multiple steps and

A congenital disorder characterized by mild to severe mental retardation, slow physical development, and characteristics physical features.
There are indicators that Joshua is a child with autism. What should Mrs. Santos his teacher do to help him?

choices.text: Recommend a special tutor for Joshua
Tell his parents to transfer him to another school
Ask Joshua so stay and give him extra care and attention
Advise his parents to take him to a specialist for diagnosis

items.question: Autism is generally evident before age three and is manifest when the child engages in _____, resists environmental change, and displayed unusual responses to sensory development.
Categories of problem behavior in students with autism include which of the following?
Autistic behavior, Rett's disorder, childhood degenerative disorder, Asperger's disorder and pervasive development disorder are sometimes referred to as
Students with autism may have which of the following characteristics of communication?

choices.text: attention focused on one type only
use of limited gestures to supplement verbal skills

items.question: Delinquents differ from non-delinquents, according to research, in that the former

choices.text: Have more emotional and more serious conflicts
Are less concerned with society's standards and demands

items.question: In dealing with slow learners, which of the following principles must a teacher take into consideration?

choices.text: The teaching and the materials used should be at the learner's level of learning
The teacher must know that the techniques most important in helping each learner towards maximum attainment
The children must proceed at the pace best suited to their abilities

items.question: Which best explains what mainstreaming in the classroom means?

choices.text: Pupils who were previously enrolled in special education classes are now integrated into regular classes
Teachers in special education centers are now teaching in the regular classrooms
Teachers of regular classes are now teaching with disabilities in special education
Pupils in the regular classroom are now accepted in special education centers

items.question: Which of the following best describes a slow learner?

choices.text: Unable to function satisfactorily in many situations
Has a broad view of the world

items.question: Which of the following is NOT true of a slow learner?
Which one best describes a fast/gifted learner?
How can the teacher best provide for the slow learner?

choices.text: giving them more free time to study on their own
giving them frequent drills on basic knowledge and skills
assigning them exercises for creative expression
assigning them same lesson as the rest of the class

items.question: Which can best account for the success of gifted individuals in later life?

choices.text: many factors related to the position of their parents in society
factors like emotional, social, and adjustment which are personal in nature

items.question: Before a teacher makes decision on how to integrate moral values in the subject she is teaching, she should consider first

choices.text: a host of factors affecting the development of values
the selection of appropriate teaching strategies
the setting up of objectives in teaching moral values
the identification of moral values in the home, school, and community

items.question: A disorder in one or more of the basic psychological processes, involved in understanding or in using language, spoken or written, which disorder may manifest disability to listen, think, speak, read, or write, speel or do mathematical operations?
________ is one of the most significant challenges facing students with learning disabilities
Which of these is the major goal in the education of children with special needs?

choices.text: Acquisition of relevant knowledge and skills
Maximization of their abilities and potentials

items.question:
The qualification that students with learning disabilities must have a significant discrepancy between actual achievement and expected achevement raises which questions?
I. How does one define expected achievement?
II. How large must the discrepancy be to be considered significant?
How much below average must the individual's IQ be?
Environmental causes of learning disabilities may include which of the following?

choices.text: a mother's alcohol and drug use during pregnancy

items.question: Keeping possible problems from becoming a serious handicapped is an example of _____ intervention
which of the following are important to child development specialists?

choices.text: protection and care of the children
education and nurture of early learners
care for the children of working parents

items.question: High levels of cortisol, the stress hormone, inhibits learning. What is an implication of this in the teaching-learning process?

choices.text: Teacher should be non-threatening in her ways.

items.question: Defense or coping mechanisms are activities/ behaviors manifested by man as one

choices.text: tries to avenge those who hurt him
focuses on the goals to be achieved
succumbs to the influence of the environment
tries to reduce the tensions and anxieties felt by him

items.question: Psychologists use the term "individual differences" to describe variations in
What is the main role of the teacher in the classroom as perceived by the cognitive psychologists?

choices.text: Prepare instructional materials for the learners
Provide varied and new information about the lessons
Dictate to the learners what and how to do with the tasks
Make the learner relate to past lessons with the new information

items.question: The teacher must be aware that both heredity and environment represent complex factors, exerting many specific influences on an individual's growth. Which of the following statements best represents the influence of heredity and environment?

choices.text: Heredity counts; environment is less important.
If the environment is changed, heredity becomes less important.
The relative heredity influences of heredity and environment can vary widely in an individual's growth.

items.question: Lila and Mila are fraternal twins. Lila is an extrovert while Mila is an introvert. Lila likes to eat spaghetti while Mila dislikes it. On the other hand, Mila gets good grades while Lila contents herself with fairly good grades. Which of the following principle does not apply in this case?

choices.text: Development patterns show wide individual differences.
Development is a product of the interaction of the organism and its environment.

items.question: Piagetian tasks state that thinking becomes more logical and abstract as children reach the formal operations stage. What is an educational implication of this finding?

choices.text: Expect hypothetical reasoning from learners between 12 to 15 years of age.
Engage children in analogical reasoning as early as preschool to train them for HOTS.
Learners who are not capable of logical reasoning from ages 8 to 11 lag behind in their cognitive development.

items.question: Which refers to Kohlberg's moral development theory?
According to Erikson's theory, the child ages 2 to 4 years ols is largely
Shame and doubt in young children can arise from

choices.text: adults refusing to allow the child to explore
children comparing their strengths against others

items.question: Some forms of experiences are called
A child who is learning to draw is slapped on the hand every time he draws on the table and wall. This form of punishment if used _____

choices.text: to increase the likelihood of an undesirable behavior
to decrease the likelihood of an undesirable behavior
to decrease the likelihood of the desirable behavior
to increase the likelihood of the desirable behavior

items.question: Teacher Sarah demonstrates to the students, one step at a time, the desired behavior of brushing one's teeth until the correct behavior is attained. What type of reinforcement is recommended?
Children have generally short attention span. What activities must be provided for them to affect learning?
Sensation is the starting point of any study of behavior and experience. This means

choices.text: all experiences must begin with sensation
perception is the follow up of sensation

items.question: In which situations is the law of readiness applied?

choices.text: the teacher gives the aims of the lessons being taken up
the teacher announces the subject matter at the start of the period
the teacher presents a song related to the lesson
the teacher prepares all the devices needed for the lessons

items.question: Which of the following is emphasized by Abraham Maslow in the Humanistic Theory?

choices.text: conflicts during the different stages of development have to be resolved
conditioning plays a part in developing social skills
people grow towards the goal self-actualization
modeling is important in the mental development

items.question: _________ or cognitive road maps are presented  before a learning experience.
Which of the following statements is true to parents and teachers?

choices.text: parents and teachers both share valuable information
parents should be involved in the social life of their children
only teacher play an important role in developing the cognitive aspect of the child

items.question: What should a teacher do if students are misbehaving in class?

choices.text: send the misbehaving pupils to the guidance counselor
involve the whole class in setting rules of conduct in the whole class
make a report to the parents about their children's misbehavior
set the rules for the class to observe

items.question: Development spreads over the body from head to foot and from central axis of the body to the extremities. Which of the following principles apply to this statement of fact?

choices.text: development follows a definite predictable pattern
each phase of development has hazards

items.question: Which of the following statement indicates the importance of parent engagement in school?

choices.text: Parental involvement contributes to parent's greater knowledge about the school program
Parental presence in school may model to the child the importance of schooling

items.question: If parents would like to foster achievement motivation, they should

choices.text: encourage their children to be independent
punish their when they don't complete their tasks well
teach their children how to do each task and never let them fail
give their children unconditional positive regard

items.question: Phil has been a truant in recent weeks. Even though he really enjoys learning, he is skipping school because he is afraid of being beaten up by other students on the way to school. This case exemplifies which theory of motivation?

Grant avoids studying because he believes that how much time you study does not matter. What matters is whether the teacher has made a tough test, how he grades it, and if he likes you. This case exemplifies what theory of motivation?

Research on the brain reveals that the number of dendrite connections in the first five years of growth are in the tens of billions. What does this underscore?
    I. The significance of stimulating early childhood education
    II. The necessity of forcing the child to learn at an early age or else may never get interested at all
    III. The need to punish preschool children when they can't follow a lesson for them to remember the lesson
    IV. The significance of right parenting
Which appropriate teaching practice flows from this research finding on the brain: the brain's emotional center is tied into its ability to learn.

choices.text: Create a learning environment that encourages students to explore their feelings and ideas freely
Come up with highly competitive games where winners will feel happy
Tell students to participate in class activities or else won't receive plus points in class recitation
To establish discipline be judgmental in attitude

items.question: Which violates this brain-based principle of teaching-learning: "Each child's brain is unique and vastly different from each other."

choices.text: Giving ample opportunity for a pupil to explore even if the class creates "noise"
Making a left-handed pupil write with his right hand as this is better.

items.question:
Research says that development in one domain (physical, social, emotional, cognitive) influences and is influenced by development in other domains. What is an educational implication of this finding?
  I. Use MI approaches
  II. Stimulate the sense of sight which is the most important to the senses
  III. Use thematic teaching
Bruner's theory on intellectual development moves from enactive to iconic and symbolic stages. Applying Bruner's, how should you teach?
Which view on intelligence runs counter to Gardner's Multiple Intelligence Theory?

choices.text: Learners can develop each of the eight multiple intelligences
Learners have a single, quantifiable intelligence
Learners are strong in some and weak in other intelligences

items.question: Richard exhibits fear response to freely roaming dogs but does not show fear when a dog is on a leash or confined to a pen. Which conditioning process is illustrated?
Bernadette enjoyed the roller coaster when they visited Enchanted Kingdom. Just at the sight of the roller coaster, she gets excited. Which theory explains Bernadette's behavior?
A teacher reinforces a student's approximations of a desired behavior until the actual behavior is demonstrated. According to behavioral theory, what type of reinforcement is this?
According to Maslow, a child will find it difficult to meet his need for self-actualization unless his _____ needs are satisfied first.
Which of the following shows Maslow's hierarchy of needs?

choices.text: meditating, securing a stable job, marrying
getting enough sleep, securing a stable job, marrying
marrying, getting enough sleep, securing a stable a job,
getting a Ph.D, providing for food, giving to charities

items.question: A student who loves to read may learn about snow and igloos, even if he has not been to Alaska. Which type of learning experiences is acquired though reading?

Based on Bandura's social learning theory, whom do children often imitate? Those who _____
   I. Have substantial influence over their lives
   II. Belong to their peer group
   III. Belong to other races
   IV. Are successful and seem admired

Megan dances well. She can figure out how something works or how to fix something that is broken without asking for help. Based on Gardner's theory of multiple intelligences, under what intelligence is Megan strong?
The teacher provides various learning activities and methods in her teaching so that needs and interests of learners are met. Which principle did she consider?
Teacher Bea clears her throat to communicate disapproval of student's behavior. Which specific technique is this?
Posture or gesture that communicates, "Don't open up to me" is an example of
The sociogram reveals that four children in your class formed a "cluster" or a "clique". This means that the teacher should

choices.text: Talk to them individually to disband the group
Encourage them to join other members of the groups with similar interests
Discourage them from forming such groups as this should not be allowed
Allow them to be together all the time

items.question: Gene stutters in class. You would like to help him. How?

choices.text: Make him recite often so he has opportunity to practice
Make him repeat orally words, phrases, sentences in class
Let him recite only when he likes it
Build up his confidence by asking him to recite when you are sure he is ready to answer

items.question: The best way to deal with a group of children who have become inattentive and restless is

choices.text: Be nice to them and ask them to sit and be quiet
Stop the class activities until they sit still
Introduce changes in the class activities
Assure them something will be given for behaving well

items.question: Which of the following would best reveal the learner's readiness for new learning activity?
The process of problem solving and learning are highly unique and individual. This principle means ______

choices.text: Students can adapt alternative problem solving models.
Students can modify their own personal styles
Each student becomes aware of how learning styles can be changed.
Each student has his/her own distinctive styles of learning and solving problems.

items.question:
Learning refers to changes in the individual due to
   I. Experience
   II. Development
   III. Maturation
   IV. Aging
Rodel gave the wrong answer. Teacher said, "Wrong! You are way off!" As a consequence other students in the class were afraid to answer questions. Which of the following is illustrated by the event?
Which teacher's attitude reflects her understanding of development as a product of maturation and learning?

choices.text: patience in dealing with the slower ones
creativity with the classroom strategies or tasks
fairness when giving grades or school marks

items.question: To ensure that all Filipino children are functionally literate, which mechanism, is meant to reach out to children who come a barangay without a school?
When is giving praise ineffective? When it _____

choices.text: Provides information to students about their competence and the value of their accomplishments
Uses the accomplishments of peers as the context for describing a student's present accomplishment
Shows spontaneity, variety, and other signs of credibility
Focuses student's attention on their won task-relevant behavior

items.question: Which diagram is used to determine the social interaction among individuals in a group?
In the context of the theory of multiple intelligence, one weakness of the paper and pencil test is ____

choices.text: it puts the non-linguistic intelligent at a disadvantage
it is not easy to administer

items.question: Allowing the students to participate in the formulation of two or three rules for the classroom promotes ____ in the classroom.

Daniel Goleman's theory on emotional intelligence highlights the role of emotion in the success or happiness of an individual. In which situation can the teacher best cultivate emphathy in the case of students fighting in the classroom?

choices.text: reprimand the students so that others will not follow the misbehavior
tell the students to stop fighting so that there will be peace in the classroom
make them realize how fighting negatively affect themselves and others
establish roles and responsibilities to avoid arguments among them

items.question: Professor B said, "We talk of developing critical thinking among our students, but when they diagree with us, we get offended." To which Filipino trait does this point?

choices.text: The lack of seriousness among Filipinos

items.question: A lecturer narrates: "I observe that when there is English-speaking foreigner in class, more ofetn than not, his classmates perceive him to be superior". To which Filipino trait does this point?
One learns Math by building on Math lessons previously learned. This is an application of the _____ theory.

Mrs. Dela Cruz developed a lesson on the concept of fraction as follows. First, she presented one whole pizza then asked a pupil to cut it into two. She called one part of the pizza 1/2 and the two parts 2/2. Then she wrote 1/2 and 2/2 on the board. She proceeded to ask another pupil to divide the half parts of the cake into two again, then wrote 1/4, 2/4, and 3/4. Then she went back to the fractions she wrote on the board. She asked her pupils for the meaning of 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 2/4.

Which part of the lesson is the symbolic stage?

choices.text: Dividing the pizza further into two.
Writing the fractions 1/2, 1/4, 1/3, 2/4 on the board
Dividing the pizza further into four

items.question:
Mrs. Dela Cruz developed a lesson on the concept of fraction as follows. First, she presented one whole pizza then asked a pupil to cut it into two. She called one part of the pizza 1/2 and the two parts 2/2. Then she wrote 1/2 and 2/2 on the board. She proceeded to ask another pupil to divide the half parts of the cake into two again, then wrote 1/4, 2/4, and 3/4. Then she went back to the fractions she wrote on the board. She asked her pupils for the meaning of 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 2/4.

Does the development of the lesson on fraction conform to the bottom-up arrangement of the learning experiences in Edgar Dale's Cone of Experience?

choices.text: Up to the second phase of the lesson only

It depends on the teaching skills of the teacher

She called one part of the pizza 1/2 and the two parts 2/2. Then she wrote 1/2 and 2/2 on the board.
